Introduction to shinyrepro

Source: vignettes/shinyrepro.Rmd
shinyrepro.Rmd
library(shinyrepro)

Using shinyrepro

There is a single exported function, repro, that will take a reactive object, and returns a character vector of the code required to run outside of Shiny to re-create the specified reactive.

Limitations

Anonymous Functions

Currently it is hard to check the contents of anonymous functions for inputs and/or reactive objects, such as functions used in the apply family functions or purrr::map. The workaround for this is to have them as named arguments, therefore they are sent to the anonymous function as updated in shinyrepro.

# Bad
purrr::map_dbl(1:10, \(x) x * input$mult)

# Good
purrr::map_dbl(1:10, mult = input$mult, \(x, mult) x * mult)
